name: Spaghetti Carbonara Pie
headline: Spaghetti Carbonara Pie

author.name: Deb Perelman : Smitten Kitchen : Food Network

recipeIngredient: 1 1/2 teaspoons coarse or kosher salt, plus more for the cooking water
8 ounces (about 2 cups) finely grated Parmesan and/or aged Pecorino-Romano

recipeInstructions.text: Heat oven to 425 degrees F. Butter a 9-inch springform pan and wrap the outside tightly in aluminum foil. Place on a baking sheet.
Chop pancetta into 1/2-inch cubes and saute over medium heat until well browned. Remove with slotted spoon and drain on paper towels.
Bring a large pot of well-salted water to a boil. Boil the broccoli rabe for 1 to 2 minutes in the salted water until it has some give. Fish it out with a large slotted spoon and drain. Set aside.

Now add the spaghetti to your boiling water and cook until 2 minutes shy of done, so very al dente. While the pasta cooks, use a towel to squeeze all excess moisture from the broccoli rabe. Separate out 1 cup of broccoli rabe and chop it finely. (Reserve the remainder for another use.)
Drain the pasta well and let cool slightly.

In large bowl, whisk eggs, yolks, milk, salt, pepper and all but 1/2 cup of cheese together. Add the spaghetti, chopped broccoli rabe and pancetta and toss to combine. Pour mixture into the prepared springform. Sprinkle last 1/2 cup cheese on top.

Bake 35 to 40 minutes, until bronzed and the center is set. The best way to check is to tip your pan to the side and make sure no loose custard runs out. If it does, bake it for 5 minutes more. If the top of your pie browns too quickly before the center is set, cover it with foil for the remaining cooking time.
Remove from the oven and let cool on a rack for 5 minutes before removing the foil, cutting around springform to loosen and releasing the pie onto a serving plate. Serve in wedges.

review.reviewBody: The broccoli rabe was unusual but tasty. But unfortunately the dish was so salty. I didn’t even add any salt and added one less cup of parmesan cheese. Won’t try this one again.
It got pretty dry in the oven, and I am going to add garlic to the pancetta next time.  Other than needing to cover it to trap the moisture, it was good!
Very dry and not much flavor. My family said it was like eating uncooked spaghetti

Fun, dramatic entrée! Used bacon bits and squeezed pkg of chopped spinach. Liquidy ingredients did seep out of well sealed springform pan leaving the top part drier than should be. Is there any springform that will not leak??

It would be great if a proofreader went over these recipes. A VERY important ingredient was left out of the cooking directions. MILK. After reviewing the ingredient list and finding I had all of the ingredients, I decided to make this for dinner later in the day. I started in on the directions and the end result came out hard as a brick and inedible. That was when I reviewed the entire recipe and realized nowhere in the directions do you include milk. One shouldn't have to watch a video to make sure all the ingredients are included in the directions.

I tried the Spaghetti Carbonara Pie.  It looked delicious.  I tried to "veganize" it.  So I used mushrooms instead of the pancetta, aquafaba instead of eggs,  vegan butter, nut milk, and nutritional yeast instead of parmesan cheese.  It didn't quite stand up into a pie--I think the mushrooms added water and I likely didn't squeeze out the greens enough.  So I ended up just putting it in a serving bowl and oh my, my guests loved it.  Very tasty.
The recipe is great but the "save recipe" button will not allow you to save recipe.
Well, I wanted to like this...and it was OK.  But, not great.  There really wasn't much flavor and I had no idea when to add the milk.

Overall, very cool idea, great to impress guests. However, suspected recipe would execute a bit dry, which it did. I served with sage pesto. Next time I'll try sautéing broccoli rabe with some olive oil & garlic before combining. 
Also note to Food Network: the milk seems to be omitted from directions.
Excellent dish with lots of leftovers!
I love smitten kitchen and this recipe was amazing!! Please note that the written instructions forget to mention adding the milk to the eggs to make the custard.

video.name: Spaghetti Carbonara Pie
video.description: From the Smitten Kitchen comes a pancetta-and-pecorino-laced pasta that looks fancy enough for a party but is simple enough for an everyday dinner.
